properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 12 at 7:39AM AKST until February 12 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 3
to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Thompson Pass through Keystone Canyon.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM AKST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall combined with strong winds and
blowing snow will produce white-out conditions. Driving will be
very difficult.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THOMPSON PASS AND KEYSTONE CANYON
